isis.stitle: 530 and DT-466/408 Diesel Engine Service (1994) - TURBOCHARGERS - REMOVAL AND INSPECTION - Cleaning

step1.para: Thoroughly clean the piping connecting the air cleaner to the turbocharger with soap and water. Dry with filtered compressed air.
Remove the vehicle mounted air cleaner and clean inside the air cleaner element housing. (Helps prevent turbocharger or engine failure.)
In the event of a turbocharger failure, inspect air intake piping for debris, clean as required and replace the air cleaner element.

note.para: DO NOT use a caustic solution turbocharger or tubes.

step1.para: Clean air inlet piping and connecting hoses with filtered compressed air.
Inspect oil inlet tube and oil drain tube for restrictions. Clean with a suitable (non-caustic) solvent and a nylon brush. Dry using filtered compressed air.
